snippet: Ehud Olmert’s allies have asserted that his prosecution was most likely instigated by right-wing political forces in Israel and encouraged by sympathetic American Jews.
abstract: Former Israeli prime minister Ehud Olmert's acquittal on corruption charges has emboldened his associates, who have asserted that case was most likely instigated by right-wing political forces in Israel and encouraged by sympathetic American Jews; Olmert is awaiting sentencing after being convicted of breach of trust, the least serious of the charges he faced, and he remains embroiled in another serious corruption case.
lead_paragraph: Ehud Olmert’s allies have asserted that his prosecution was most likely instigated by right-wing political forces in Israel and encouraged by sympathetic American Jews.

headline.seo: Failed Graft Trial of Ex-Israeli Premier Spurs Questions
headline.main: Failed Graft Prosecution of Former Israeli Premier Spurs Political Questions
headline.print_headline: Failed Graft Prosecution Of Former Israeli Premier Spurs Political Questions
